intro: Ampliglossum viperinum, commonly known as the viper's bugloss, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are tubular and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a slight woolly texture.
